comments.body: Can you give a scenario or use case for this? I'm trying to wrap my head around what you are trying to accomplish.

comments.author: Barleyologist
comments.body:
Sure I pipe values in to an array and present those values to be chosen in the Out-Grid.  These values contain spaces and searching for them is difficult.  I am currently using [Get-CMDriver] to pull all Windows drivers from ConfigMgr (SCCM/MEMCM) , then I present those drivers for selection via Out-GridView.  The driver list can be 10,000 drivers long and I need to narrow my search for the driver I am looking for.  That search field is the best way to accomplish this. I pull driver [name] and [ContentPath]  fields and  I use Out-GridView to locate the drivers I am look to remove from SCCM\MEMCM by their ContentPath.  The ContentPath  contains spaces [Win 10 - Dell - Latitude 3400 (64Bit) A05] and I would love to type [Latitude 3400] but I can only type [Latitude3400].  As a result I have to copy the text [Latitude 3400] to perform my search in order to select the object I wish to interact with.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Installing the GraphicalTools module should give you an Out-GridView command that is more or less a drop-in replacement for the original.

From what I've seen, the PS team doesn't have any interest maintaining the old cmdlet any longer, so I don't like your chances for getting it fixed. 🙂

comments.author: jdhitsolutions
comments.body:
I get this to work with the updated module. Be sure to install the module and allow clobbering to overwrite the old version of Out-Gridview.

```powershell
install-module microsoft.powerShell.graphicaltools -allowclobber
```

The new `Out-Gridview` behaves a little differently. It behaves more like a Convert cmdlet. You will need to specify the properties you want to see. Even then, I had to specify the full name to the new version.

```powershell
dir c:\work -file | Select LastWriteTime,Length,Name | microsoft.powershell.graphicaltools\out-gridview
```

I ended up overwriting the `ogv` alias.

```powershell
set-alias -name ogv  -value microsoft.powershell.graphicaltools\out-gridview -force
```
